result.execSummary:
All charges against Michael J Cashman in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael J Cashman is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Defendant in court with Attorney Robert Brendan Hurley.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The State moved to dismiss this case. Court orders dismissed.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

03:35 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Robert Brendan Hurley.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael J Cashman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Def appeared for drug screening.  Defendant referred to Attorney to consult about DPU.

Status conference on January 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on March 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 12 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

11:19 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Robert Brendan Hurley.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Defendant referred for screening.  Status conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
